image.altText: A small group of US Marines crouching or standing in a row in red dirt, holding rifles.

items.synopsis: Authorities confirm five US Marines have been flown to Royal Darwin Hospital, with one currently undergoing surgery. More personnel are expected to be evacuated from the crash site on Melville Island shortly.

title.children: Twenty-three US Marines injured after military aircraft crash on Tiwi Islands

image.altText: A white woman with blonde hair and glasses smiles as she speaks to an indigenous woman

items.synopsis: The family of a domestic violence advocate murdered by her partner have welcomed Elisabeth Armitage to Anthepe town camp on the outskirts of Alice Springs.

title.children: 'Her spirit is with us': Family of murdered DV advocate welcome NT coroner to her home

image.altText: An Indigenous man standing in a forest with remnants of a brick building behind him

items.synopsis: In 1824, British soldiers and convicts landed on the shores of the Tiwi Islands with ambitions to build an international trade port to rival Singapore. Here's why their plan failed.

title.children: 'We are warriors': Fort Dundas ruins symbolise the strength of the Tiwi people

image.altText: An old school photo with a male and female teacher. The faces of children are blurred.

items.synopsis: For decades, Victoria's education department shuffled paedophile teachers to new schools where they abused more schoolchildren. As the historical scale of the scourge in the Victorian public system becomes clearer, there are calls for the state to confront the issue with a broader inquiry.

title.children: Frances Brown had an 'absolutely horrific gut feeling' about what was happening in the classroom down the hall. Her intuition would prove heartbreakingly correct

image.altText: emergency services at a crash scene where two young boys died

items.synopsis: The boys, aged nine and 10, were in the car along with a nine-year-old girl, when it crashed into a tree on The Grand Parade in Monterey just before 10pm on Friday.

title.children: Driver charged over horror Sydney crash may not be aware 'two little ones have lost their lives'

image.altText: Xanax pills generic

items.synopsis: While the role of opioids in the deaths of thousands of Australians who die of drug overdoses has remained relatively stable, there are concerns the presence of potent synthetic opioids like fentanyl may ramp up.

title.children: As opioids continue to dominate fatal drug overdoses in Australia, the threat of fentanyl taking hold remains

image.altText: A composite of Dmitry Utkin, Vladimir Putin and Yevgeny Prigozhin

items.synopsis: Whether the apparent downing of a Wagner plane stacked with Putin's enemies was an accident or an assassination, Russia's president reaps the rewards. This is what we know about the crash that changed everything.

title.children: In Putin's Russia, nothing is as it seems. But did he just unleash his own Night of the Long Knives?

image.altText: A composite image of the faces of two men and a woman.

items.synopsis: Russia has been blamed for the plane crash that reportedly killed Wagner chief Yevgeny Prigozhin, but many other Kremlin opponents have met similarly grisly fates.

title.children: Nerve agents, poison and open windows have claimed many past enemies of the Kremlin — here are those we know of

image.altText: A man in grey shirt and blue shorts wades through shallow water carrying a red esky on his shoulder, two boats behind him

items.synopsis: For months, the bodies of young migrants have been washing up on the beaches of Tunisia's Mediterranean coast. They are among thousands of sub-Saharan Africans fleeing extreme poverty and war, taking desperate journeys to escape.

title.children: Every morning, Bilal goes fishing in the Mediterranean. Almost every day, he finds human remains

image.altText: GFXb_Paretophone_HACK_Digital-25

items.synopsis: The number of charities revealing their donors have had personal information leaked to the dark web is growing, as the tally of Australians implicated exceeds 50,000.

title.children: More than 50,000 Australians affected in charity data breach, credit card data stolen

image.altText: Army cadets in full camouflage, holding guns during a demonstration in front of an audience in a field.

items.synopsis: The federal opposition says an allegation students could not wear uniforms on Friday is "coercive" and "overtly political".

title.children: ADF Academy cadets claim they were pressured to remove uniforms for Wear It Purple Day

image.altText: a man holding a dog and a broom and a woman holding a walkie talkie and spray bottle, both smiling, standing by toilet cubicles

items.synopsis: Chris and Judy Sims made their daughter a promise before she died. What came next was an odyssey of "outrageous" things, honouring their daughter's wish that they live life to the fullest.

title.children: Personal tragedy led this couple to a calling as Dunny Angels at outback music festivals

image.altText: A smiling middle-aged woman with long, dark hair sits on a rural property, holding a large truffle.

items.synopsis: The owners of a farm near Mount Gambier knew there was no guarantee that they would ever find a truffle in their orchard, but this season has delivered in spades.

title.children: At $1,500 a kilo, truffles have been found on this orchard for the first time, thrilling the hobby farm's new owners

image.altText: Two police officers stand on a road

items.synopsis: Florida police say the man had authored "several manifestos" before barricading himself in a discount shop and killing three black people.

title.children: Racially-motivated mass shooting ' dark day in Jacksonville's history'

image.altText: A military fighter pilot in uniform poses for a photo holding his helmet.

items.synopsis: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says one of the three men killed when two L-39 combat training aircraft collided was Major Andriy Pilshchykov, who won fame in dog fights over Kyiv during the early days of the war.

title.children: Mid-air training crash kills Ukrainian pilot who had fought Russians in dog fights over Kyiv

image.altText: Graphic with recorders on the left and a group of women playing recorders on the right.

items.synopsis: This group of 50-somethings are taking the recorder and using it to make not only beautiful music but lifelong friends.

title.children: It often gets a bad rap, but fans of the recorder say the instrument's reputation is undeserved

image.altText: Julia Gillard, a red-headed woman in a suit, speaks at microphones during a press conference.

items.synopsis: The South Australian government commits $70 million to begin implementing the recommendations, including a nation-leading preschool program for three-year-olds, and a major expansion of out-of-school-hours care.

title.children: Royal commission recommends South Australia expand out-of-school-hours care

image.altText: Baby singing with parent

items.synopsis: We make up endless silly, sweet, spontaneous songs to sing to our children. Have you ever thought about why?

title.children: The sweet silly songs we sing to our kids aren't just for fun — they change their brain

image.altText: pa Chantelle Anderson and gigi

items.synopsis: As Australia tries to control the risk of rabies from the importation of cats and dogs, these pet owners say the country's strict policy has cost them time, money and in one case, their dog's health.

title.children: Chantelle's dog Gigi spent six months in quarantine. She says Gigi 'will never recover' physically from the ordeal

items.synopsis: In an offbeat way to relax and find inner calm, these yogis are enjoying baby goat cuddles, "lots of laughing" and even a few "nibbles" in between their poses.

title.children: Miniature goat yoga brings stress release and 'so much joy' to small country town

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

items.synopsis: The proposed move would see those who commit the most horrific types of murder die in prison, in the wake of the conviction of killer nurse Lucy Letby.

title.children: UK plans to impose mandatory whole-life orders on extreme murderers

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man in a jacket and tie on a parade float giving his autograph to some children.

items.synopsis: At age 20, David Rees joined the team of Australia II in the America's Cup campaign and became one of its "celebrities for a day" when it won, taking the cup from the New York Yacht Club for the first time in 132 years.

title.children: 'It was mad': What it was like to be a part of the Australia II sailing team in 1983

image.altText: A person shopping at Australian grocery store, with a basket full of sparkling water, fruits and vegetables.

items.synopsis: Everything we consume contains energy our bodies use to move, grow and maintain health. To work out how much energy is in different foods and drinks, we need to first look at a few core concepts.

title.children: Confused about calories and kilojoules? Here's a run down of what food labels actually mean

image.altText: An Australian female tennis players awaits to receive a serve during the US Open qualifying rounds.

items.synopsis: Former teenage prodigy Olivia Gadecki will make her US Open debut after successfully qualifying for the season's final major in New York.

title.children: Aussie Gadecki qualifies for first US Open

image.altText: Retired Sydney Swans star Lance Franklin waves to the crowd while holding his son in his arms, his wife and daughter near him.

items.synopsis: A big crowd says farewell to the retired Lance Franklin at half-time between the Swans and Demons at the SCG. Later, GWS can secure finals with a win or draw against Carlton after Port Adelaide's win over Richmond. Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre.

title.children: AFL live: Bravo Buddy - Swans say goodbye to Lance Franklin, Power secure third before Carlton-GWS showdown

image.altText: A Brisbane NRLW player dives through the air and plants the ball down with one hand near the corner flag for a try.

items.synopsis: Defending premiers Newcastle defy a Cronulla comeback to to seal their fifth win of the season, after Brisbane's big win over the Raiders comes at the cost of an injury to the Broncos' skipper.

title.children: Broncos stay in hunt with big win over Raiders, Knights withstand comeback from Sharks

image.altText: Nicole Werner smiles, holding a microphone as she addresses a Liberal Party function.

items.synopsis: Liberal Party candidate Nicole Werner wins the seat of Warrandyte by a hefty margin, in a by-election that was not contested by Labor.

title.children: Newly elected Victorian Liberal MP pays tribute to migrant parents in victory speech

image.altText: Woman poses in front of hundreds of barbie dolls

items.synopsis: In Russia, Barbie fans will finally get the chance to see the blockbuster film on the big screen, including this avid collector of 12,000 dolls.

title.children: Tatiana owns 12,000 Barbie dolls. She hasn't seen the movie yet due to sanctions on Russia

image.altText: A man and woman unload bales of hay from a truck

items.synopsis: Farmers in New South Wales are concerned about the prospect of the state plunging into another drought, saying there has been an alarmingly rapid return to dry conditions.

title.children: 'A major drought event is forming': Why farmers fear history is repeating itself

image.altText: An Australian female sprint paddler pumps her right fist as she celebrates winning a world championship.

items.synopsis: Aly Bull wins back-to-back world titles as Australia remains at the top of the medal table at the ICF Canoe Sprint and Paracanoe World Championships in Germany.

title.children: Sprint paddler Bull adds another gold to Australia's medal tally at world champs

image.altText: Man stands with hand raised in front of pink, blue and purple sparkly background

items.synopsis: Actor Adam Sandler leads tributes to the "the best" veteran US host, who coined the phrase "come on down" on hit game show The Price is Right.

title.children: Bob Barker, 'world's greatest MC' and The Price is Right host dies aged 99

image.altText: A plastic-gloved hand holds a string of plastic vials that have red liquid at the bottom

items.synopsis: Australian scientists look to overseas providers of an important but increasingly hard-to-get abattoir by-product.

title.children: A vital ingredient for cancer research is in tight supply with the price rising

image.altText: the outside of a burnt out house

items.synopsis: NSW Fire and Rescue is still investigating the cause of the blaze but says four lithium batteries were found at the scene.

title.children: Man dies in 'futile attempt' to extinguish fire possibly caused by batteries in Sydney

image.altText: A bright orange sail drone on the water with a city in the distance

items.synopsis: The Southern Ocean controls the melt of the Antarctic ice sheet, but scientists say more observational science is needed, and they have a range of tools to help.

title.children: These sea drones travel thousands of kilometres in waters too dangerous for scientists

image.altText: Man with arms crossed smile in billboard on wall as woman walks past.

items.synopsis: Incumbent leader Emmerson Mnangagwa, known as The Crocodile, wins another term but the opposition says the win was the result of "voter suppression".

title.children: Zimbabwean president 'The Crocodile' wins re-election, but not everyone is convinced
